trustfund:
TF039510-COLOMBIA - SUSTAINABLE
            DEVELOPMENT OF THE SIERRA NEVADA (LIL)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Colombia Sierra Nevada
            Sustainable Development Project were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some of the main
            lessons learned included confirmation that in a
            violence-ridden and socially complex region, civil society
            and nongovernmental organizations are adequate partners in
            effective interventions, particularly where the presence of
            public institutions is weak. In fact, its engagement with
            the public sector can precisely introduce the institutional
            dynamic and the spirit of collective decision making
            necessary in this situation, in two ways: (i) enhancing
            government capacity to operate in difficult conditions; and
            (ii) promoting community participation and social
            responsibility. Also, Learning and Innovation Loans (LILs)
            are valuable lending instruments for pioneer projects and
            for interventions in complex and delicate contexts; their
            value added is particularly clear in the design of projects
            that face risky conditions. The flexibility of the
            Foundation as Project Executor and its recognition in the
            Sierra as a neutral independent actor helped to overcome the
            risks identified at preparation and encountered during
            implementation. Finally, the project introduced a
            participatory operational framework for rural development
            and ecological conservation in the Sierra Nevada.
            Interventions in the past were too small, fragmentary, or
            isolated, as well as paternalistic. The project gave
            grassroots organizations full responsibility for execution
            and use of funds
